citations.narrative:
Two approximately 3-month-old puppies are housed with an adult dog that is not their mother or foster mother. Housing
puppies in the same primary enclosure with adult dogs that are not the dam could cause incompatibility which may result
in injury to the puppies should the adult become aggressive. Incompatible housing may also result in the failure of the
puppy to access food and water should the adult exhibit resource guarding behaviors.
Puppies 4 months of age or less may not be housed in the same primary enclosure with adult dogs other than their dams
or foster dam. The licensee must either remove the adult dog from the enclosure or house the two puppies with pen
mates that meet the compatibility requirements. The licensee must ensure that each dog is compatibly housed at all
times in order to support their health and well-being.
To be corrected by: The licensee provided the puppies with compliant housing at the time of the inspection.

One female French bulldog ("Zanna", tag #142) is currently being treated with penicillin. No written treatment plan for the
use of penicillin can be found, but the licensee stated that the penicillin is to be given for 10 days. Failure to document
treatment plans may interfere with the ability of APHIS officials to determine if the dogs are receiving adequate veterinary
care.
Each dealer shall keep copies of medical records that includes the date and a description of the problem (injury, disease,
illness), examination findings, test results, plan for treatment and care, and treatment procedures performed. The
licensee must ensure that all treatment plans are documented and that all medical records are complete and contain all
required information.
To be corrected by: From this day forward

On 25-March-2022, the licensee had four dogs tested for heartworm and fecals. The documented results of these tests
could not be located. Failure to document test results could interfere with the ability of APHIS officials to determine if the
animals are receiving adequate veterinary care.
Each dealer shall keep copies of medical records that includes the dates and findings/results of all screening, routine, or
other required or recommended tests or examinations. The licensee must document the results of all heartworm testing
and fecals and ensure that the results of all other exams and tests are documented on a medical record that is complete
and contains all required information.
To be corrected by: From this day forward
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.7(c) 
   
Compatible grouping. 
Two approximately 3-month-old puppies are housed with an adult dog that is not their mother or foster mother.  Housing 
puppies in the same primary enclosure with adult dogs that are not the dam could cause incompatibility which may result 
in injury to the puppies should the adult become aggressive.  Incompatible housing may also result in the failure of the 
puppy to access food and water should the adult exhibit resource guarding behaviors.   
 
Puppies 4 months of age or less may not be housed in the same primary enclosure with adult dogs other than their dams 
or foster dam.  The licensee must either remove the adult dog from the enclosure or house the two puppies with pen 
mates that meet the compatibility requirements.  The licensee must ensure that each dog is compatibly housed at all 
times in order to support their health and well-being.   
 
To be corrected by:  The licensee provided the puppies with compliant housing at the time of the inspection. 
3.13(b)(2) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
One female French bulldog ("Zanna", tag #142) is currently being treated with penicillin.  No written treatment plan for the 
use of penicillin can be found, but the licensee stated that the penicillin is to be given for 10 days.  Failure to document

treatment plans may interfere with the ability of APHIS officials to determine if the dogs are receiving adequate veterinary 
care. 
 
Each dealer shall keep copies of medical records that includes the date and a description of the problem (injury, disease, 
illness), examination findings, test results, plan for treatment and care, and treatment procedures performed.  The 
licensee must ensure that all treatment plans are documented and that all medical records are complete and contain all 
required information.   
 
To be corrected by:  From this day forward 
3.13(b)(4) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
On 25-March-2022, the licensee had four dogs tested for heartworm and fecals.  The documented results of these tests 
could not be located.  Failure to document test results could interfere with the ability of APHIS officials to determine if the 
animals are receiving adequate veterinary care.   
 
Each dealer shall keep copies of medical records that includes the dates and findings/results of all screening, routine, or 
other required or recommended tests or examinations.  The licensee must document the results of all heartworm testing 
and fecals and ensure that the results of all other exams and tests are documented on a medical record that is complete 
and contains all required information. 
 
To be corrected by:  From this day forward 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.

n
